org.apache.beam.it.gcp.bigquery

Class BigQueryResourceManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.beam.it.gcp.bigquery.BigQueryResourceManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.beam.it.common.ResourceManager

    public final class BigQueryResourceManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.apache.beam.it.common.ResourceManager
    Client for managing BigQuery resources.

    The class supports one dataset, and multiple tables per dataset object.

    The class is thread-safe.

    • Nested Class Summary

      static class  BigQueryResourceManager.Builder
      Builder for BigQueryResourceManager.

      • getDatasetId

        public java.lang.String getDatasetId()
        Return the dataset ID this Resource Manager uses to create and manage tables in.
        Returns:
        the dataset ID.

      • createDataset

        public java.lang.String createDataset(java.lang.String region)
                               throws BigQueryResourceManagerException
        Create a BigQuery dataset in which all tables will exist.
        Parameters:
        region - the region to store the dataset in.
        Returns:
        Dataset id that was created
        Throws:
        BigQueryResourceManagerException - if there is an error creating the dataset in BigQuery.

      • createTable

        public com.google.cloud.bigquery.TableId createTable(java.lang.String tableName,
                                                     com.google.cloud.bigquery.Schema schema)
                                              throws BigQueryResourceManagerException
        Creates a table within the current dataset given a table name and schema.

        This table will automatically expire 1 hour after creation if not cleaned up manually or by calling the cleanupAll() method.

        Note: Implementations may do dataset creation here, if one does not already exist.

        Parameters:
        tableName - The name of the table.
        schema - A schema object that defines the table.
        Returns:
        The TableId (reference) to the table
        Throws:
        BigQueryResourceManagerException - if there is an error creating the table in BigQuery.

      • createTable

        public com.google.cloud.bigquery.TableId createTable(java.lang.String tableName,
                                                     com.google.cloud.bigquery.Schema schema,
                                                     java.lang.Long expirationTimeMillis)
                                              throws BigQueryResourceManagerException
        Creates a table within the current dataset given a table name and schema.

        This table will automatically expire at the time specified by expirationTime if not cleaned up manually or by calling the cleanupAll() method.

        Note: Implementations may do dataset creation here, if one does not already exist.

        Parameters:
        tableName - The name of the table.
        schema - A schema object that defines the table.
        expirationTimeMillis - Sets the time when this table expires, in milliseconds since the epoch.
        Returns:
        The TableId (reference) to the table
        Throws:
        BigQueryResourceManagerException - if there is an error creating the table in BigQuery.

      • write

        public void write(java.lang.String tableName,
                  com.google.cloud.bigquery.InsertAllRequest.RowToInsert row)
           throws BigQueryResourceManagerException
        Writes a given row into a table. This method requires createTable(String, Schema) to be called for the target table beforehand.
        Parameters:
        tableName - The name of the table to insert the given row into.
        row - A row object representing the table row.
        Throws:
        BigQueryResourceManagerException - if method is called after resources have been cleaned up, if the manager object has no dataset, if the table does not exist or if there is an Exception when attempting to insert the rows.

      • write

        public void write(java.lang.String tableName,
                  java.util.List<com.google.cloud.bigquery.InsertAllRequest.RowToInsert> rows)
           throws BigQueryResourceManagerException
        Writes a collection of table rows into a single table. This method requires createTable(String, Schema) to be called for the target table beforehand.
        Parameters:
        tableName - The name of the table to insert the given rows into.
        rows - A collection of table rows.
        Throws:
        BigQueryResourceManagerException - if method is called after resources have been cleaned up, if the manager object has no dataset, if the table does not exist or if there is an Exception when attempting to insert the rows.

      • runQuery

        public com.google.cloud.bigquery.TableResult runQuery(java.lang.String query)
        Runs the specified query.
        Parameters:
        query - the query to execute

      • getRowCount

        public java.lang.Long getRowCount(java.lang.String table)
        Gets the number of rows in the table.
        Parameters:
        table - the name of the table

      • readTable

        public com.google.cloud.bigquery.TableResult readTable(com.google.cloud.bigquery.TableId table)
                                                throws BigQueryResourceManagerException
        Reads all the rows in a table and returns a TableResult containing a JSON string representation. This method requires createTable(String, Schema) to be called for the target table beforehand.
        Parameters:
        table - The table reference to read rows from.
        Returns:
        A TableResult containing all the rows in the table in JSON.
        Throws:
        BigQueryResourceManagerException - if method is called after resources have been cleaned up, if the manager object has no dataset, if the table does not exist or if there is an Exception when attempting to insert the rows.

      • readTable

        public com.google.cloud.bigquery.TableResult readTable(java.lang.String tableName)
                                                throws BigQueryResourceManagerException
        Reads all the rows in a table and returns a TableResult containing a JSON string representation. This method requires createTable(String, Schema) to be called for the target table beforehand.
        Parameters:
        tableName - The name of the table to read rows from.
        Returns:
        A TableResult containing all the rows in the table in JSON.
        Throws:
        BigQueryResourceManagerException - if method is called after resources have been cleaned up, if the manager object has no dataset, if the table does not exist or if there is an Exception when attempting to insert the rows.

      • readTable

        public com.google.cloud.bigquery.TableResult readTable(com.google.cloud.bigquery.TableId table,
                                                       int numRows)
                                                throws BigQueryResourceManagerException
        Reads number of rows in a table and returns a TableResult containing a JSON string representation. This method requires createTable(String, Schema) to be called for the target table beforehand.
        Parameters:
        table - The table reference to read rows from.
        Returns:
        A TableResult containing all the rows in the table in JSON.
        Throws:
        BigQueryResourceManagerException - if method is called after resources have been cleaned up, if the manager object has no dataset, if the table does not exist or if there is an Exception when attempting to insert the rows.

      • readTable

        public com.google.cloud.bigquery.TableResult readTable(java.lang.String tableName,
                                                       int numRows)
                                                throws BigQueryResourceManagerException
        Reads number of rows in a table and returns a TableResult containing a JSON string representation. This method requires createTable(String, Schema) to be called for the target table beforehand.
        Parameters:
        tableName - The name of the table to read rows from.
        numRows - number of rows to read from the table
        Returns:
        A TableResult containing all the rows in the table in JSON.
        Throws:
        BigQueryResourceManagerException - if method is called after resources have been cleaned up, if the manager object has no dataset, if the table does not exist or if there is an Exception when attempting to insert the rows.

      • cleanupAll

        public void cleanupAll()
                throws BigQueryResourceManagerException
        Deletes all created resources (dataset and tables) and cleans up the BigQuery client, making the manager object unusable.
        Specified by:
        cleanupAll in interface org.apache.beam.it.common.ResourceManager
        Throws:
        BigQueryResourceManagerException - if there is an error deleting the tables or dataset in BigQuery.
